Package gui.view

Class MenuScene

java.lang.Object
gui.view.MenuScene
public class MenuScene
extends java.lang.Object
This class implements the menuScene. This scene is the first scene that is shown, when starting the game. It provides buttons for a new game, load game, help and end game.
Author:
Judith

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private LSButton buttonLoadGame
    button for reloading the old game
    private javafx.scene.layout.Pane menuPane
    new pane that holds all the nodes of the menuScene
    private javafx.scene.Scene menuScene
    new scene that show the menuPane
    private static java.lang.String PATH_TO_BACKGROUND_IMAGE
    String with the path to the background image of the scene

    Constructor Description
    MenuScene()
    Constructs an object of the class MenuScene.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void buttonDisabled()
    This method helps to set the button load game disabled or not. e.g. when the game is played for the first time, the button should be disabled as there is nothing to be reloaded.
    javafx.scene.Scene getMenuScene()
    Getter for the menuScene.
    private void initializeButtons()
    This method implements the buttons of the menu.
    private void initializeMenuPane()
    This method sets the style of the menuPane and initializes the buttons with the method initializeButtons().

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuScene

      public MenuScene()
      Constructs an object of the class MenuScene. It initializes the menuPane with the method initializeMenuPane().

  • Method Details

    • initializeMenuPane

      private void initializeMenuPane()
      This method sets the style of the menuPane and initializes the buttons with the method initializeButtons().

    • initializeButtons

      private void initializeButtons()
      This method implements the buttons of the menu. Therefore, it uses a VBox.

    • getMenuScene

      public javafx.scene.Scene getMenuScene()
      Getter for the menuScene.
      Returns:
      the requested menuScene.

    • buttonDisabled

      private void buttonDisabled()
      This method helps to set the button load game disabled or not. e.g. when the game is played for the first time, the button should be disabled as there is nothing to be reloaded. Therefore, it proofs if the text file exits.
